content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. The Fund consists of appropriated amounts and payments. The Foundation will use the Fund for necessary expenses to operate the Institute. The Revolving Fund is separate from the Trust Fund and not subject to certain program priorities. The Secretary of the Treasury will invest portions of the Fund not needed for current expenses. The Secretary of the Treasury will invest a portion of the Revolving Fund in interest-bearing obligations of the United States, either on original issue or by purchasing outstanding obligations at market price. Any obligations acquired by the Fund can be sold at market price, with interest and proceeds credited back to the Fund. SEC. 11. USE OF THE INSTITUTE BY A FEDERAL AGENCY. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow for the use of the Institute by a Federal agency. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to authorize Federal agencies to utilize the Foundation and the Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services in environmental, public lands, or natural resource disputes. Federal agencies can contract and pay for Institute services, with payments going into a Revolving Fund. Agencies must notify the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before using the Foundation or Institute, providing details on the issues and parties involved. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends Section 13 of the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to authorize appropriations to the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund for specified fiscal years. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. SEC. 9. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends various sections of the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 to replace references to the "Fund" with "Trust Fund."
